thread.title: Heart of America’s Oil Boom Can’t Fetch Good Prices for Its Crude

author: Alison Sider
title: Heart of America’s Oil Boom Can’t Fetch Good Prices for Its Crude
text:
The main U.S. oil benchmark, West Texas Intermediate, has soared to its highest level in years at $71 a barrel. Good luck getting that price in west Texas.
In the epicenter of America’s drilling boom, crude is going for less than $60 because oil output there has overwhelmed pipelines that connect the Texas desert to markets along the Gulf Coast and abroad.
